intro: Scaphochlamys perakensis, commonly known as the Bornean orchid, is a tropical plant native to the island of Borneo. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded forest environments. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish-white, with intricate patterns that aid in pollination by specific insect species. Scaphochlamys perakensis plays a role in the ecological balance of its habitat, supporting biodiversity through its interactions with pollinators and other forest organisms.
